FFA Installs New Chapter Officers

On Thursday, June 11th the Putnam County FFA Chapter held its' officer installation ceremony in the middle school auditorium. The officer interviews for this were held on May 28th, 2020. The new officers were (l-r): President, Maggi F; 1st Vice President, Emily D; 2nd Vice President, Carsen S; Secretary, Justin W; Treasurer, Katelyn R; Reporter, Tori G; Sentinel, Vanessa B; Historian, Cora H; Parliamentary, Grace S; and Chaplain, Chase S (not pictured).

Also at this event, a few awards were presented. The Star FFA Greenhand was awarded to freshman Chase S. This award is given to the most outstanding first-year member. The Star Placement in Agribusiness was presented to Mason P. This is given to a member with an outstanding placement SAE program. The Star Chapter Farmer award was presented to Lainie C. This award is for a student with an outstanding production-based SAE program. The final award presented was the Dekalb Outstanding Senior Award, and this was presented to Tony B.

#putnamproud

There are so many resources out there to help parents keep their children engaged in learning while at home. Here are just a few. Our teachers have used different methods to keep our parents and students informed: email, Google Sites (you can find your teacher's Google Site on our school website), Google Classroom, paper packets for preschool - 2nd grade, Google Meet, Class Dojo, Facebook classroom groups, Remind app, and more. Stay tuned for more ideas on activities you can do to keep your student learning while at home. Remember, progress over perfection. Reading a book with your student and talking about what you read, playing a board game together, getting some exercise while going for a walk together, those are all great ways to nurture your student mentally, physically, and emotionally.

Good afternoon parents of Putnam County R-I students. I know this is an unbelievably difficult time for us all. The board of education and I are committed to keeping families informed regarding the decision making process as related to the COVID-19 virus.

At this time we are working hard to make the most well-informed decisions possible. We are following the most recent recommendations from the Center for Disease Control that schools remain in session.

We are in constant communication with our local health department including a meeting with them and other local officials this afternoon. This will be followed by a special meeting with our Board of Education this evening. We promise to communicate as the situation evolves.

We are committed to the safety of our students, staff, and community while continuing to monitor the situation and keeping you informed.

Thank you for your understanding.
